summary: This is an internal DOJ email from August 14, 2019, reporting that federal prosecutors and investigators are probing whether two staffers guarding Jeffrey Epstein's unit the night of his death falsified records about their check-in frequency. The note indicates they could face criminal charges in the Southern District of New York.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The document references the night of his death while he was in custody, and that staffers were guarding his unit.

events.title: DOJ Email on Epstein Guard Probe
events.description: An internal DOJ email reports that federal prosecutors and investigators are probing whether two staffers guarding Jeffrey Epstein's unit the night of his death falsified records logging their check-in frequency.

events.title: Epstein's Death and Guard Record Falsification Probe
events.description: Federal prosecutors and investigators are probing whether two staffers guarding Jeffrey Epstein's unit the night of his death falsified records about how often they were checking on him. If found guilty, they could face criminal charges.

keyFacts: Federal prosecutors and investigators are probing whether two staffers guarding Jeffrey Epstein's unit the night of his death falsified records.
The falsified records reportedly logged how often the staffers were checking on Epstein.
If the staffers are found to have falsified records, they could face criminal charges in the Southern District of New York.
The document is an internal DOJ email dated August 14, 2019, indicating an active investigation into the circumstances surrounding Epstein's death.
